Mono valued parameters - Those parameter.description:
Final status in which the change Request will be after acceptance.

Possible values:
  • pending deployment
  • deployed

examples.title: Example usage:
examples.content:
// Update display name: 
curl -H "X-API-Token: yourToken" -X POST http://rudder.example.com/rudder/api/latest/changeRequests/42/accept -d "status=deployed"

examples.title: Success-Response:
Success-Response:
Success-Response:

Mono valued parameters - Those parameter.description:
The status of change requests you want to display.

Possible values:
  • pending validation
  • pending deployment
  • cancelled
  • deployed
  • open (pending validation + pending deployment)
  • closed (cancelled + deployed)
  • all

Unique identifier of the data source to create.
The human readable name of the data source to create.
Description of the goal of the data source to create.
Enable or disable data source.
Duration in seconds before aborting data source update. The main goal is to prevent never ending requests. If a periodicity if configured, you should set that timeout at a lower value.
Parameters to configure when the data source is fetched to update node properties. See below for details.
Trigger a fetch at the begining of a policy generation
Trigger a fetch when a new node is accepted, for that node
Configure if data source should be fetch periodicaly (see below for configuration)
"scheduled": enable periodic update; "notscheduled": disable them
duration in seconds between the end of an update, and the start of the following.
Define and configure data source type. For now, only "http" data source is supported. See below for its Configuration
Data source type name. Only "http" is supported for now.
Data source type specific parameters. See below for HTTP data source parameters.

[JSON option for \"parameters\"] HTTP da.description: HTTP method to use to contact the URL.
Represent HTTP headers for the query. JSON array of {"name":"xxx","value":"yyy"}. Rudder expansion available.

JSON path (as defined in https://github.com/jayway/JsonPath/, without the leading "$.") to find the interesting sub-json or string/number/boolean value in the answer. Let empty to use the whole answer as value.
Check SSL certificate validity for https. Must be set to false for self-signed certificate
Timeout in seconds for each HTTP request
Configure the strategy used to query the HTTP data source. For now, only a node by node strategy is available (see below)
Name of the strategy to use. For now, only available is "byNode": make one request for each node

title: 7. Check that update on a Directive is valid
name: checkDirective

Mono valued parameters - Those parameter.description: Name of the Directive to create.
Short description of the Directive.
Long description of the Directive.
Directive parameters.
Enable/disable the Directive. Used to be 'isEnabled' in response, look here for more details.
Directive priority. Determines which value to use if there are several Directives based on the same technique applied to a Node.
Technique Version.
Policy mode to execute the directive with. Can be "default", "enforce" or "audit".

Multi valued parameters - Those paramete.description: Tags linked to this directive. As JSON, send an object { "key1":"value1", ..., "keyN":"valueN"}. As query paramereter, send a "key:value" pair for each tag.

examples.title: Example usage:
examples.content:
// Update display name: 
curl -H "X-API-Token: yourToken" -X POST http://rudder.example.com/rudder/api/latest/directives/DirectiveID/check  -d "displayName=Name of New Directive"

Mono valued parameters - Those parameter.description: The id of the Directive the clone will be based onto. missing source will
The name of the Directive to create, this parameter is mandatory
The full list of parameters. This parameter can be empty, but the Directive will not be applied.
Short description of the Directive.
Long description of the Directive.
Define the id of the Directive to create, Rudder will generate an id if this is missing. You should only use it for specific use case
Enable the Directive at creation. But this parameter can be overriden. Used to be 'isEnabled' in response, look here for more details.
Directive priority. Determines which value to use if there are several Directives based on the same technique applied to a Node.
version as source] Define the technique version used. By default it will used the version of the cloned Directive
Policy mode to execute the directive with. Can be "default", "enforce" or "audit".

title: 0. Node information format
description:
Here, we are describing all the available properties on node details on each of the three level: minimal, default and full. As explain in documentation for the "include" parameters in relevants API call, you can also specify the list of included first level properties you want to get.

A value is returned only if it is defined for the node. For example, "license" are rarelly defined for Linux software and so software won't have that data.

Properties returned by include=minimal.description: Status of the node in Rudder (pending, accepted, deleted)

Properties returned by include=default.description: A human intended description of the node
Array of all IPs (v4 and v6) for the node
(Rudder 5.0.9 and up) Date and time (yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm) of the last run, if one is available (node time)
Date and time (yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm) of the last generated inventory report (node time)
In the case of VM, the VM technologie
If available, a unique identifier provided by the machine
OS name (distribution for Linux, name for Windows, ...)
OS Version (depend of the OS Familly and name)
The long, detailled name as reported by the OS
Array of management agents and their type running on the node
Rudder unique ID of the policy server from which the node get its policies
Array of node properties (either set by user or filled by third party sources)
Property value, which can be a string or a full-fledge JSON data object
Rudder policy mode for the node ("enforce", "audit", or "default" if the node follows the global configuration)

Properties returned by include=full.description: Array of user accounts declared in the node
System provided description of the BIOS (long name)
Array of environement variable objects defined on the node in the context of the agent
Array of file system objects declared on the node.
Total space allocated to the file system
Array of additionnal information about management technologie
Array of public key used by the agent
Name of the memory slot or memory module
Detailled information about registered network interfaces on the node
information about the type of network interface
network interface status (enable or not, up or down)
Array of IP addresses for that network interface
TTY to which the process is attached
Memory allocated to the process (at inventory time)
CPU used by the process (at inventory time)
Virtual memory allocated to the process (at inventory time)
Number of thread by core for the CPU
Array of physical extension slot information objects
Array of software on the node. This can be huge (thousands)
Name of the software (as reported by the node)
system provided description of the sound card
quantity of memory for that video card
resolution used by that video card at inventory time
system provided description for that video card
Array of hosted virtual machine information objects
Unique identifier of the hosted virtual machine
Number of virtual CPU allocated to the hosted virtual machine
Status (up, starting, etc) of the hosted virtual machine
Memory allocated to the hosted virtual machine
system provided description of the hosted virtual machine

name: Response_format_documentationApiNodesPendingApiNodesApiNodesNodeid

Multi valued parameters - Those paramete.description: Level of information to include from the node inventory. Some base levels are defined (minimal, default, full). You can add fields you want to a base level by adding them to the list, possible values are keys from json answer. If you don't provide a base level, they will be added to default base level, so if you only want os details, use "minimal,os" as the value for this parameter

examples.title: Success-Response:

title: 8. Trigger an agent run
name: applyPolicy

Multi valued parameters - Those paramete.description: Set class passed as parameter to make it available during agent run.

description: This API allows to trigger an agent run on the target node. Response is a stream of the actual agent run on the node (no json output).

examples.title: Success-Response:
examples.content:
HTTP/1.1 200 OK

Rudder agent 4.1.0~alpha1~git201701101529-jessie0 (CFEngine Core 3.10.0)
Node uuid: root
Start execution with config [20170110-161552-3325af7a]

M| State         Technique                 Component                 Key                Message
E| compliant     Common                    Update                                       Rudder ncf instance already up to date on this root server. No action required.
E| compliant     Common                    ncf Initialization                           The ncf initialization was correct
E| compliant     Common                    Security parameters                          The internal environment security is acceptable
E| compliant     Common                    Red Button                                   Red Button is not in effect, continuing as normal...
E| n/a           Common                    Process checking                             CFEngine proccesses check is done by the rudder-agent CRON job
E| compliant     Common                    CRON Daemon                                  Cron daemon status was correct
E| compliant     Common                    Log system for reports                       Logging system for report centralization is already correctly configured
E| compliant     Common                    Binaries update                              The CFEngine binaries in /var/rudder/cfengine-community/bin are up to date
E| compliant     DistributePolicy          Configure ncf                                Configure ncf was correct
E| compliant     DistributePolicy          Propagate promises                           All files have been propagated
E| compliant     DistributePolicy          Send inventories to CMDB                     No inventory to send
E| compliant     Inventory                 inventory                                    Next inventory scheduled between 00:00 and 06:00
E| compliant     server-roles              Check logrotate configur|                    The logrotate configuration is correct
E| compliant     server-roles              Check LDAP in rudder-web|                    The Rudder Webapp configuration files are OK (checked LDAP password)
E| compliant     server-roles              Check LDAP credentials                       The OpenLDAP configuration file is OK (checked rootdn password)
E| compliant     server-roles              Check SQL in rudder-weba|                    The Rudder Webapp configuration files are OK (checked SQL password)
E| compliant     server-roles              Check SQL credentials                        The Rudder PostgreSQL user account's password is correct and works
E| compliant     server-roles              Check rudder-passwords.c|                    The Rudder passwords file is present and secure
E| compliant     server-roles              Check allowed networks c|                    The Rudder allowed networks configuration is OK
E| compliant     server-roles              Check WebDAV credentials                     The Rudder WebDAV user and password are OK
E| compliant     server-roles              Check apache process                         Check apache process running was correct
E| compliant     server-roles              Check apache boot script                     Check apache boot starting parameters was correct
E| compliant     server-roles              Check jetty process                          Check jetty process running was correct
E| compliant     server-roles              Check configuration-repo|                    The /var/rudder/configuration-repository directory is present
E| compliant     server-roles              Check configuration-repo|                    The /var/rudder/configuration-repository GIT lock file is not present or not older than 5 minutes
E| compliant     server-roles              Check rudder status                          The http://localhost:8080/rudder/api/status web application is running
E| compliant     server-roles              Check endpoint status                        The http://localhost:8080/endpoint/api/status web application is running
E| compliant     server-roles              Check slapd process                          Check slapd process running was correct
E| compliant     server-roles              Check PostgreSQL configu|                    There is no need of specific postgresql configuration on this system
E| compliant     server-roles              Check postgresql process                     Check postgresql process running was correct
E| compliant     server-roles              Check postgresql boot sc|                    Check postgresql boot starting parameters was correct
E| n/a           server-roles              Send metrics to rudder-p|                    Sending metrics to rudder-project is not enabled. Skipping.

## Summary #####################################################################
32 components verified in 4 directives
   => 32 components in Enforce mode
         -> 30 compliant
               -> 2 not-applicable
               execution time: 2.39s
################################################################################

title: 7. Trigger all agent run
name: applyPolicyAllNodes

Multi valued parameters - Those paramete.description: Set class passed as parameter to make it available during agent run.

description: This API allows to trigger an agent run on the target node. Response contains a json stating if agent could be started on each node, but not if the run went fine and do not display any output from it. You can see the result of the run in Rudder web interface or in the each agent logs

Parameter.description: The new status of the node (refused/accepted)

examples.title: Error-Response:

title: 1. List accepted Nodes
name: listAcceptedNodes
description: That function allow you to get details of accepted Nodes. You can make query on those Nodes based on inventory criterion. You can use the same queries than those used in NodeGroup queries

Multi valued parameters - Those paramete.description: Level of information to include from the node inventory. Some base levels are defined (minimal, default, full). You can add fields you want to a base level by adding them to the list, possible values are keys from json answer. If you don't provide a base level, they will be added to default base level, so if you only want os details, use "minimal,os" as the value for this parameter. Details of returned properties at each level are given in the dedicated menu entry.

Query parameters - Those parameters will.description: A query json object like we use as query in NodeGroups. A three field json object { 'composition' : 'and', 'select' : 'node', 'where' : [{"objectType":"node","attribute":"OS","comparator":"eq","value":"Linux"}]}, That parameter can be replaced by the three following (select, composition, where)
The criterion you want to find for your nodes like '[{"objectType":"node","attribute":"OS","comparator":"eq","value":"Linux"}]}'
Boolean operator to use between each criteria. Other value is "And". Only used if 'where' is defined.
What kind of data we want to include. Here we can get policy servers/relay by setting 'nodeAndPolicyServer'. Only used if where is defined.

examples.title: Example usage (curl):
examples.content:
# Get all nodes having a hostname starting with node1 and based on Linux
curl -H "X-API-Token: yourToken" 'https://rudder.example.com/rudder/api/latest/nodes?where=\[\{"objectType":"node","attribute":"OS","comparator":"eq","value":"Linux"\},\{"objectType":"node","attribute":"nodeHostname","comparator":"regex","value":"node1.*"\}\]'

examples.title: Example usage (python-requests):
Success Response (curl):

Multi valued parameters - Those paramete.description: Level of information to include from the node inventory. Some base levels are defined (minimal, default, full). You can add fields you want to a base level by adding them to the list, possible values are keys from json answer. If you don't provide a base level, they will be added to default base level, so if you only want os details, use "minimal,os" as the value for this parameter

title: 6. Update Node settings and properties
name: updateNode

Multi valued parameters - Those paramete.description: A property of the Node defined by its name and its value. Values are non-empty UTF-8 strings. Setting a key to the empty string removes it from the list of properties for that node.

Parameter.description: In which mode the node will apply its configuration policy. You can choose between "audit" and "enforce" modes, or "default" to use the global mode

The node lifecycle state. You can choose between "enabled", "ignored", "empty-policies", "initializing", and "preparing-eol" state. See https://docs.rudder.io/reference/current/usage/advanced_node_management.html#node-lifecycle for more information.
The agent key, dict containing two keys: "status" (optional, can be "certified" or "undefined") and "value" (optional, in PEM format (either certificate or public key)).

description: This API allows to update the node settings.

examples.title: Initial content
Set properties and change to audit mode
examples.content:
# Setting properties from "data.json" and policy mode to audit:
curl -H "X-API-Token: yourToken" -X POST  -H "Content-Type: application/json" https://rudder.example.com/rudder/api/latest/nodes/NodeID -d @properties.json

examples.title: Remove one property, change another one
examples.content:
# Removing the key "utf-8 poetry" from the command line and updating the "env_type" one:
curl -H "X-API-Token: yourToken" -X POST  -H "Content-Type: application/json" https://rudder.example.com/rudder/api/latest/nodes/NodeID -d '{ "properties": [{ "name":"utf-8 poetry", "value":""}, {"name":"env_type", "value":"deprovisioned"}] }'

examples.title: Remove a property, change another one and switch to default mode
examples.content:
# Removing the key "env_type" and changing "shell" and use default policy mode:
curl -H "X-API-Token: yourToken" -X POST  https://rudder.example.com/rudder/api/latest/nodes/NodeID -d "properties=shell=/bin/false" -d "properties=env_type=" -d "policyMode=default"

Long description of the Rule.

enabled the Rule at creation. But this parameter can be overriden : if you want to create Rule with directives and Rule targets directly with workflow enabled, the Rule will be created disabled (to prevent creating active Rule without validation). But this parameter can be overriden. Used to be 'isEnabled' in response, look here for more details.

Multi valued parameters - Those paramete.description: link one directive to the Rule. value needs to be an existing directive ID.
Link one target to the Rule. Rule targets are "group:groupId" and the special targets : "special:all" and "special:all_exceptPolicyServers".
Tags linked to this Rule. As JSON, send an object { "key1":"value1", ..., "keyN":"valueN"}. As query paramereter, send a "key:value" pair for each tag.

examples.title: Example usage:
examples.content: curl -H "X-API-Token: yourToken" -X PUT 'http://rudder.example.com/rudder/api/latest/rules?prettify=true'  -d "source=RuleIDSource" -d "displayName=Name of New Rule"

title: 3. Create a new Rule
name: createRule
description: Create a new Rule in Rudder. You can define all of its parameters, but you need at least its name

examples.title: Example usage:
examples.content: curl -H "X-API-Token: yourToken -X PUT 'http://rudder.example.com/rudder/api/latest/rules' -d "displayName=Name of New Rule"

Mono valued parameters - Those parameter.description: Name of the Rule.
Define the id of the Rule to create, Rudder will generate an id if this is missing. You should only use it for specific use case.
Short description of the Rule.
Long description of the Rule.

enabled the Rule at creation. But this parameter can be overriden : if you want to create Rule with directives and Rule targets directly with workflow enabled, the Rule will be created disabled (to prevent creating active Rule without validation). But this parameter can be overriden. Used to be 'isEnabled' in response, look here for more details.

Multi valued parameters - Those paramete.description: link one directive to the Rule. value needs to be an existing directive ID.
Link one target to the Rule. Rule targets are "group:groupId" and the special targets : "special:all" and "special:all_exceptPolicyServers".
Tags linked to this Rule. As JSON, send an object { "key1":"value1", ..., "keyN":"valueN"}. As query paramereter, send a "key:value" pair for each tag.

title: 11. Create a new Rule category.
name: createRuleCategory
description: Create a new Rule category in Rudder. You can define all of its parameters, but you need at least its name

Mono valued parameters - Those parameter.description: Name of the Rule category.
Description of the Rule category.
Id of the parent Rule category

examples.title: Example usage:
examples.content: curl -H "X-API-Token: yourToken" -X POST 'http://rudder.example.com/rudder/api/latest/rules/categories' -d "name=new category" -d "parent=4306143d-eabf-4478-b7b1-1616f4aa02b5" -d "description=A new category created via API'

examples.title: Success-Response:

title: 5. Delete a Rule
name: deleteRule
description: Delete the Rule having the ID passed in the URL

examples.title: Error-Response:
examples.content:
HTTP/1.1 500
{
  "action":"deleteRule",
  "id":"176ad06b-ed02-4da3-8053-16225d217741",
  "result":"error",
  "error details":"Could not delete Rule 176ad06b-ed02-4da3-8053-16225d217741 cause is: Could not find Rule 176ad06b-ed02-4da3-8053-16225d217741."
}

title: 9. Delete a Rule category
name: deleteRuleCategory
description: Delete a Rule category. It must have no child rules and no children categories

title: 8. Get a Rule category details
name: getRuleCategoryDetails
description: Get the details of a Rule category, whose ID is specified in the URL

title: 1. List all Rules
name: listRules
description: Get all Rules available in Rudder

title: 2. Get a Rule details
name: ruleDetails
description: Get details for one Rule by specifying its ID in the URL

title: 4. Update a Rule
name: updateRule
description: Modify any parameters of a Rule. Missing parameters means to not modify that parameter

Mono valued parameters - Those parameter.description: Name of the Rule.
Enable/disable the Rule. Used to be 'isEnabled' in response, look here for more details.
Short description of the Rule.
Long description of the Rule.

Multi valued parameters - Those paramete.description: Link one directive to the Rule. value needs to be an existing directive ID.
Link one target to the Rule. Rule targets are for groups : "group:groupId", nodes : "node:nodeId" and the special targets : "special:all" and "special:all_exceptPolicyServers".
Tags linked to this Rule. As JSON, send an object { "key1":"value1", ..., "keyN":"valueN"}. As query paramereter, send a "key:value" pair for each tag.

examples.title: Example usage:
examples.content:
Update display name: 
curl -H "X-API-Token: yourToken" -X POST 'http://rudder.example.com/rudder/api/latest/rules/RuleID' -d "displayName=Name of Rule"

title: 10. Update a Rule Category
name: updateRuleCategory
description: Modify any parameters of a Rule category. Missing parameters means to not modify that parameter

Mono valued parameters - Those parameter.description: Name of the Rule category.
Description of the Rule category.
Id of the parent Rule category

title: 0. List of all available settings
description: Here is the list of all settings that can be managed within Rudder.

Parameter.description: Define the default setting for global policy mode, either "enforce" or "audit"
Allow overrides on this default setting
Agent run schedule - time between agent runs (in minutes)
First agent run time - hour
First agent run time - minute
Maximum delay after scheduled run time (random interval)
Number of days to retain modified files
Number of days to retain agent output files
Require time synchronization between nodes and policy server

Method used to synchronize data between Rudder Server and Relays, either "classic" (agent protocol, default), "rsync" (use rsync to synchronize, that you'll need to be manually set up), or "disabled" (use third party system to transmit data)
If "rsync" is set as a synchronization method, use rsync to synchronize policies between Rudder Server and Relays. If false, you'll have to synchronize policies yourself.
If "rsync" is set as a synchronization method, use rsync to synchronize shared files between Rudder Server and Relays. If false, you'll have to synchronize shared files yourself.
Default reporting protocol used, either "HTTPS" or "SYSLOG" (can be overriden on a node basis)
Completely disable rudder syslog protocol
Protocol used for syslog communication between node and server, either "UDP" (default) or "TCP"
Compliance reporting mode, either "full-compliance" (default), "changes-only" or "reports-disabled"
Send heartbeat every heartbeat_frequency runs (only on "changes-only" compliance mode)
Log all reports received to /var/log/rudder/reports/all.log
Enable change audit logs
Make message mandatory
Explanation to display
Enable Change Requests
Allow self validation
Allow self deployment
Display changes graphs
Enable script evaluation in Directives
Send anonymous usage statistics
Set default state for node when they are accepted within Rudder, can be "enabled", "ignored", "empty-policies", "initializing", "preparing-eol"
Default policy mode for accepted node, can be "default", "enforce" or "audit"
Ignore duplicated compliance reports (default true)
Allows multiple reports for configuration based on a multivalued variable (default true)
Compute list of changes (repaired reports) per rules (default true)
Recompute all dynamic groups at the start of policy generation (default true)
Store all compliance levels in database (default true)
Store all compliance details in database (default false)
Set the policy generation parrallelism, either as an number of thread (i.e. 4), or a multiplicative of the number of core (x0.5) (default 0.5)
Policy generation JS evaluation of directive parameter timeout in seconds (default 30)
Policy generation continues on error during NodeConfiguration evaluation (default false)

name: Response_format_documentationApiSettings

title: 0. List of all available settings
description: Here is the list of all settings that can be managed within Rudder.

If "rsync" is set as a synchronization method, use rsync to synchronize policies between Rudder Server and Relays. If false, you'll have to synchronize policies yourself.
If "rsync" is set as a synchronization method, use rsync to synchronize shared files between Rudder Server and Relays. If false, you'll have to synchronize shared files yourself.
Protocol used for syslog communication between node and server, either "UDP" (default) or "TCP"

Enable change audit logs
Make message mandatory
Explanation to display

Allow self validation
Allow self deployment

Enable script evaluation in Directives
Send anonymous usage statistics
Set default state for node when they are accepted within Rudder, can be "enabled", "ignored", "empty-policies", "initializing", "preparing-eol"
Default policy mode for accepted node, can be "default", "enforce" or "audit"

title: 0. List of all available settings

Number of days to retain agent output files

name: Response_format_documentationApiSettings

examples.title: Success-Response:
examples.content:
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
{
  "action": "getAllSettings",
  "result": "success",
  "data": {
    "settings": {
      "global_policy_mode": "enforce",
      "global_policy_mode_overridable": true,
      "run_frequency": 5,
      "first_run_hour": 0,
      "first_run_minute": 0,
      "splay_time": 4,
      "modified_file_ttl": 30,
      "output_file_ttl": 7,
      "require_time_synchronization": true,
      "rsyslog_reporting_protocol": "UDP",
      "rudder_report_protocol_default": "HTTPS",
      "syslog_protocol_disabled": true,
      "reporting_mode": "full-compliance",
      "heartbeat_frequency": 1,
      "log_all_reports": true,
      "enable_change_message": true,
      "mandatory_change_message": false,
      "change_message_prompt": "Please enter a reason explaining this change.",
      "enable_change_request": false,
      "enable_self_validation": true,
      "enable_self_deployment": true,
      "display_recent_changes_graphs": true,
      "enable_javascript_directives": "enabled",
      "send_metrics": "not defined",
      "node_onaccept_default_state": "enabled",
      "node_onaccept_default_policyMode": "default",
      "unexpected_allows_duplicate": true,
      "unexpected_unbound_var_values": true,
      "rudder_compute_changes": true,
      "rudder_generation_compute_dyngroups": true,
      "rudder_save_db_compliance_levels": true,
      "rudder_save_db_compliance_details": false,
      "rudder_generation_max_parallelism": "x0.5",
      "rudder_generation_js_timeout": 30,
      "rudder_generation_continue_on_error": false

    }
  }
}
